title.narrative: Enhancing the marketability and profitability of sheep woo

description.narrative: To promote Sustainable Livelihood through enhancing the marketability and profitability of sheep wool in the Jordan Badia area

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
1.1. Grade of cleanliness of the wool 1.2. No. of sheep keepers switching from manual shearing (using blade shears) to mechanical shearing 1.3. No. of proper storage measures and facilities established
2.1. No. of sheep keepers switching from manual shearing (using blade shears) to mechanical shearing 2.2. Amount/quantities of wool sheared and collected per shear per time unit (season)/ increase in shear yield
3.1. No. of capacity assessments conducted for the relevant cooperatives and sheep keepers 3.2. No. of capacity development plans/activities carried out for the target groups. 3.3. No of sheep keepers benefiting from training programs 3.4. No of sheep keepers using the shearing machines appropriately 3.5 No. of sheep shorn their wool 3.6 Quantity of wool sheared 4.1. Quantities and quality of wool collected at storage facilities 4.2. Cost Savings Percentage of shearing services 5.1. New business model for wool collection is in place. 5.2. No. of sheep keepers engaged in the project activities. 5.3. A well-established framework for wool sector is in place and institutionalized. 6.1. Amount of wool being disposed in open space 6.2. No. of awareness activities conducted and No. of livestock keepers engaged in such activities. 7.1 No. of Jobs created

comment.narrative:
The sheep wool sector in Jordan is heavily fragmented. There is no organized wool collection as a necessary part of the wool market chain. A lot of raw wool is out of the market channels. This is a key problem identified by livestock owners and wholesalers.
The sheep wool sector faces many constraints including; the low quality of initial production of the shear sheep wool, the use of traditional shearing equipment, which is not efficient and harms the animals, the cost of shearing mainly due to the use of old and inefficient shearing techniques and the weak domestic trade and export.

1. Capacity of rangeland cooperatives to provide the shearing service to individual sheep keeper enhanced 2. Wool sector trade organized for the benefit of all partners 3. Potential domestic Use of Sheep wool is explored

1. 11 local rangeland cooperatives across Badia regions were equipped with Shearing equipments and tailored-business plans to provide the shearing services for livestock owners in their home areas. 2. Business model that organize the collaboration and partnership mechanisms between the livestock owners, Local Cooperatives and the wool collection hub is developed and operationalized 3. Cooperation with individual national researchers and professionals on sheep wool industry was established to explore the potential products of wool yarn production in order to motivate the local consumption of the sheared wool 4. Building the skills of women sector in the Badia region on the shearing practices in order to create resource of income for women in the region

 The project will promote innovations and good practices in a rather neglected field of sheep wool industry and this has a clear and strong relevance to gender. Wool processing, sorting, grading, dyeing, knitting, will evolve again and are areas for greater participation for women. Stakeholder engagement meetings, in preparation for the project have had equitable participation from women and men and issues highlighted by both women and men have, therefore, been considered in the development of this project.
The project will have a direct and tangible economic impact for the sheep keeper community members in saving half of the shearing cost and marketing their sheared wool

1. Vocational training on best wool shearing practices was tailored and implemented targeting 50 local people ( 16 women) 2. New automated shearing equipments were provided for 11 Community -based Organizations across the Northern and Middle Badia regions 3. Wool collection hub was established and equipped in the Northern Badia to organize the wool trading and wool processing.
